page.title: 05TRANSPORT IN NEWTOWN AREA
page.content: Most people in this area consider a car is essential and many families have at least two. Very few people ever use the public bus service as it only serves a very small part of it. Four buses run between Portsmouth and Droxford and back daily except Sunday. The bus service has decreased in the past 20 years as car ownership has increased. The increased price of petrol lately has made the bicycle more popular. Mopeds are practical especially for 16 year olds, at 17 they usually have motorbikes & cars. School buses transport children to their designated schools if they live over 2 miles from Primary and over 3 miles from Secondary School. The elderly and infirm find transport a problem but voluntary groups will take them to necessary appointments and to luncheon clubs in Wickham and Swanmore
